page.title: 01Introduction to Lydden.
page.content: The area which we have been given to investigate is predominantly rural in character.There are a number of farms. Crops are produced and sheep and cattle are grazed.It has a sprinkling of deciduous woodland and is of a hilly nature.Much land is owned by the Ministry of Defence and is used for military exercises.The busy A2 by pass runs through the north of the area.The main centre of population is at Lydden with a small cluster of houses at Coldred.Most of the children in the area attend the local primary school at Lydden.Lydden has been described as a commuter village.There are few sources of employment in the area.There is a road haulage firm adjoining the A2.The main Dover-Victoria railway line runs through the district but there is no railway station.Lydden and Coldred are served by local bus transport.
